intro: Calycocorsus, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the stems are often hairy. Calycocorsus is native to parts of the southeastern United States and is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological benefits.
